verses.verse: Most assuredly, I say to you that you will weep and (Mark 16:10; Luke 23:48; 24:17) lament, but the world will rejoice; and you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into (Luke 24:32, 41) joy.

(Gen. 3:16; Is. 13:8; 26:17; 42:14; 1 Thess. 5:3) A woman, when she is in labor, has sorrow because her hour has come; but as soon as she has given birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.
Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and (Luke 24:41; John 14:1, 27; 20:20; Acts 2:46; 13:52; 1 Pet. 1:8) your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you.
“And in that day you will ask Me nothing. (Matt. 7:7; (John 14:13; 15:16)) Most assuredly, I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name He will give you.
Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, (John 17:13) that your joy may be (John 15:11) full.

(Jesus Christ Has Overcome the World) “These things I have spoken to you in figurative language; but the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figurative language, but I will tell you (John 7:13) plainly about the Father.
In that day you will ask in My name, and I do not say to you that I shall pray the Father for you;
((John 14:21, 23)) for the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and (John 3:13) have believed that I came forth from God.
(John 13:1, 3; 16:5, 10, 17) I came forth from the Father and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world and go to the Father.”
His disciples said to Him, “See, now You are speaking plainly, and using no figure of speech!
Now we are sure that (John 21:17) You know all things, and have no need that anyone should question You. By this (John 17:8) we believe that You came forth from God.”
Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?

(Zech. 13:7; Matt. 26:31, 56; Mark 14:27, 50; Acts 8:1) Indeed the hour is coming, yes, has now come, that you will be scattered, (John 20:10) each to his own, and will leave Me alone. And (John 8:29) yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.

These things I have spoken to you, that ((Is. 9:6; Rom. 5:1; Eph. 2:14)) in Me you may have peace. (2 Tim. 3:12) In the world you will have tribulation; but be of good cheer, (Rom. 8:37; (1 John 4:4)) I have overcome the world.”
(Jesus Prays for Himself) Jesus spoke these words, lifted up His eyes to heaven, and said: “Father, (John 12:23) the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son also may glorify You,

(Dan. 7:14; Matt. 11:27; John 3:35; (Phil. 2:10; Heb. 2:8)) as You have given Him authority over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many (John 6:37, 39; 17:6, 9, 24) as You have given Him.
And ((Is. 53:11); Jer. 9:23, 24) this is eternal life, that they may know You, (1 Cor. 8:4; 1 Thess. 1:9) the only true God, and Jesus Christ (John 3:34) whom You have sent.
(John 13:31) I have glorified You on the earth. ((Dan. 9:24); John 4:34; 19:30) I have finished the work (Is. 49:3; 50:5; John 14:31) which You have given Me to do.
And now, O Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory (Prov. 8:22-30; John 1:1, 2; Phil. 2:6; Col. 1:15; Heb. 1:3) which I had with You before the world was.

(Jesus Prays for His Disciples) (Ps. 22:22) “I have manifested Your name to the men (John 6:37) whom You have given Me out of the world. (Ezek. 18:4; Rom. 14:8) They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.
Now they have known that all things which You have given Me are from You.

For I have given to them the words (John 8:28) which You have given Me; and they have received them, (John 8:42; 16:27, 30) and have known surely that I came forth from You; and they have believed that (Deut. 18:15, 18) You sent Me.
“I pray for them. ((1 John 5:19)) I do not pray for the world but for those whom You have given Me, for they are Yours.
And all Mine are Yours, and (John 16:15) Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them.

((Mark 16:19; Luke 24:51); John 13:1; (Acts 1:9; Heb. 4:14; 9:24; 1 Pet. 3:22)) Now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to You. Holy Father, ((1 Pet. 1:5); Jude 1) keep through Your name those whom You have given Me, that they may be one (John 10:30) as We are.

While I was with them in the world, (Heb. 2:13) I kept them in Your name. Those whom You gave Me I have kept; and ((John 6:39; 18:9); 1 John 2:19) none of them is lost (Matt. 27:4, 5; John 6:70; Acts 1:16-20) except the son of perdition, (Ps. 41:9; 109:8; John 13:18; Acts 1:20) that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
